grid selection instructions:
If you want to observe in some other tile, change the tile number here. Mobiilivihko warns you if you're crossing the lines of the chosen tile.

If you want to observe in many tiles, mark each tile's observations as separate trips.
incorrect format: Sending failed, the allowed image formats are
infotext.lolife.1: The application has been developed by the Finnish Museum of Natural History Luomus in the project Flying Squirrel LIFE which is coordinated by Metsähallitus Parks & Wildlife Finland. The EU-funded project aims to improve conservation of the flying squirrel in the EU by improving viable habitat networks in the future.
infotext.lolife.2: The project has received funding from the LIFE Programme of the European Union. The material reflects the views by the authors, and the European Commission or the EASME is not responsible for any use that may be made of the information it contains.
infotext.mobilevihko.1: Mobile Nature Notebook is an application for saving nature observations to Finnish Biodiversity Info Faculty's observation service. Log in as a user in webpage
infotext.mobilevihko.2: The application is especially meant for tracking the path traveled in nature and writing down the most important observations. It saves the path with the help of GPS and shows it on the map. Observations can be added to the map, and basic details (such as unit count) and images can be attached to them.
infotext.mobilevihko.3: When the trip or environment work has been finished, the app saves for example, the time spent in the event. After finishing, the whole observation event is sent to Notebook-service. There one can add more observations and further details.
instructions.document:
Here you can fill in and edit the data of the whole observation event (trip), such as the locality name and the start and end time.

When you are finished, press the green save button. In this case, the application asks if you want to send the observation event to Notebook. After the submission, you can continue editing the observations in Notebook at <0>Laji.fi/vihko</0>, but no longer in the Nature Notebook.

If you do not send an observation event to the Notebook immediately, it will only be saved on your phone. You can see unsent observation events on the Nature Notebook front page, and you can send them to the Notebook later.

<1>More instructions</1>
instructions.home:
Nature Notebook is an application for storing nature observations in the Notebook observation service of the Finnish Biodiversity Info Facility. The application can record the exact location of observations, basic information and photos, as well as save the traveled path.

From the home page, you can select the form on which you want to record observations. The trip form is suitable for all taxon groups, the other forms have been adapted for different monitoring projects.

On the home page, you will also see unsaved observation events. Select one of them to edit it or send it to the Notebook service. After sending, the observations can no longer be edited in the Nature Notebook, only in the Notebook service at <0>Laji.fi/vihko</0>.

- <1>More instructions</1>

- <2>Privacy policy</2>

- <3>Terms of use</3>

--

The application has been developed by the Finnish Museum of Natural History Luomus, and it has received funding among others from the flying squirrel LIFE project coordinated by Metsähallitus. The aim of this European Union funded project is to improve the conservation of the flying squirrel by taking into account the future habitat networks that are essential for the survival of the species. <4>Learn more</4>.

The project has received funding from the European Union's LIFE program. The contents of this material only reflect the views of the author, and the European Commission and EASME cannot be held responsible for any use which may be made of the information contained therein.
instructions.login:
Nature Notebook is an application for saving nature observations into Finnish Biodiversity Info Faculty's Notebook-service. You can mark the observations' accurate location, basic details and images and save the path of the trip with the app. The observations are sent to Notebook-service and they'll become available via Laji.fi-portal.

Using Nature Notebook requires signing up as a Laji.fi-portal user. You can register at <0>Laji.fi</0> after which you can login in the mobile application.

-<1>More instructions</1>

-<2>Privacy policy</2>

-<3>Terms of service</3>
instructions.lolife.1: Start recording without prestored location OR select the location, which was established at Species.fi
instructions.lolife.2: Liituri starts GPS tracking automatically and stores your track.
instructions.lolife.3: Point in the map, where you want to add an observation and select the observation type from the selection that becomes visible.
instructions.lolife.4: Add new observations along the trail.
instructions.lolife.5: Edit or move an observation by selecting a point nearby the observation, after which you can select the observation that you want to edit from the menu that opens to the left.
instructions.lolife.6: Stop the observation event by touching the red square at the top right corner of the screen and you will be taken to the homepage.
instructions.lolife.7: At the bottom of the homepage, you will find the list of your unsaved events, which can be checked, amended and stored in to FinBIF data warehouse.
instructions.lolife.intro: Liituri is an observation service designed for recoding Flying squirrel observations in the field.
instructions.map:
Nature Notebook automatically saves the route you have traveled.

To add an observation, press the map for a moment at where the observed organism is. (Do not record your own location on the map.) To add an observation to where you are, briefly press the circle that shows your location on the map.

To edit an already saved observation, press the map near it for a while and select the observation you want to edit from the list.

To stop observing, press the red end button. After this, you will no longer be able to add new observations to this observation event (trip).

<0>More instructions</0>
instructions.mobilevihko.1: Choose the form of your choice from the top of the home screen and begin observing. The trip form suits all taxon groups.
instructions.mobilevihko.2: The application tracks the traveled path automatically.
instructions.mobilevihko.3: To add an observation, long press the map in the spot where the organism is. (Don't add your own position.) To add an observation to your own position, short press the circle which shows where you are at.
instructions.mobilevihko.4: To edit an observation that's already recorded, long press the map nearby it.
instructions.mobilevihko.5: When you want to stop observing, press the red button. Then the observations are saved into your phone, but not yet elsewhere.
instructions.mobilevihko.6: You can edit the whole observation event's (trip's) details. When you save these, the application asks whether you want to send them to the Notebook-service.
instructions.mobilevihko.7: In the home page you see the observation events that you haven't sent to Notebook yet.
instructions.mobilevihko.8: After sending you can continue editing the observations in Notebook in the webpage
instructions.mobilevihko.intro: Save nature observations from all taxon groups to species.fi database.
instructions.mobilevihko.intro.fungi: With the Fungi Atlas form you can save observations to Fungi Atlas (sieniatlas.fi).
instructions.observation:
Here you can add or edit more detailed information for the observation.

The name of the species or other taxon is mandatory, you can complete other information as needed.

In the count field, you can enter the quantity in numbers, a verbal description of the abundance, or more detailed information related to the quantity. E. g.

- 5

- abundant

- 3 flowering and 10 non-flowering

- 1Ä, /3 ad p

<0>More instructions</0>
instructions.overview:
Here you can start editing the information of the observation event, sending it to Notebook or deleting it.

If you send an observation event to Notebook, you can continue editing the observations in Notebook at <0>Laji.fi/vihko</0>, but no longer in the Nature Notebook.

You can also edit individual observations.

<1>More instructions</1>
